title: CalCOFI CTD data — calcofi_ctd
text: subset CTD casts CalCOFI cruise 1708SR (July 2017). Uses "Final 1m-Binned" data. four stations' downcasts included. stations 083.3 070.0, 083.3 110.0, 090.0 070.0, 090.0 110.0.

title: CalCOFI CTD data — calcofi_ctd
CalCOFI CTD data — calcofi_ctd
text: calcofi_ctd data frame 2058 rows 7 columns: station_id Station ID depth, temperature, salinity CTD readings. Depth m, temperature degC, salinity PSU datetime_utc, longitude, latitude Time location CTD reading.

title: CalCOFI CTD data — calcofi_ctd
text: https://calcofi.org/data/oceanographic-data/ctd-cast-files

title: Plot the results of
text: Plot results "hot hand" simulations

title: Plot the results of
Plot the results of
text: sim_results [numeric(n)] vector post-streak chomp-rates multiple simulations simulation parameters. trend_results [data.frame] data frame columns chomp_attempts, chomp_rate, streak_rate. row represents results single hot hand simulation. simulation parameters row described columns chomp_attempts chomp_rate.

title: Plot the results of
text: [ggplot] ggplot : plot_hothand_trends(): mean "post-streak" chomp rate (solid lines) chomp attempts (dashed lines) different independent chomp rates. plot_hothand_simulation(): histogram "post-streak" chomp rates mean simulated rate represented solid red line independent chomp rate indicated dashed red line.

what: Plot the isothermal layer depth — plot_ild
title: Plot the isothermal layer depth — plot_ild
text: Creates plot temperature depth, highlighting landmarks needed calculate isothermal layer depth (ILD) according methods Kara et al. (2000).

title: Plot the isothermal layer depth — plot_ild
code: plot_ild(cast, n, h_b, t_b, h_ref, t_ref)

title: Plot the isothermal layer depth — plot_ild
text: cast [data.frame] data frame CTD cast data, containing columns temperature depth. n [numeric(1)] index last CTD point base ILD. h_b [numeric(1)] depth ILD base. t_b [numeric(1)] temperature ILD base. h_ref [numeric(1)] depth ILD reference temperature. t_ref [numeric(1)] ILD reference temperature.

title: Plot the isothermal layer depth — plot_ild
text: [ggplot] ggplot CTD cast isothermal layer, landmarks labeled.

title: Plot the isothermal layer depth — plot_ild
text: Kara_2000marinecs100b

title: Plot the isothermal layer depth — plot_ild
code: # You (the student) will calculate these values in one of the modules! n <- 22 h_b <- 23.83 t_b <- 16.41 h_ref <- 19 t_ref <- 17.21 cast <- calcofi_ctd[calcofi_ctd$station_id == "083.3 070.0", ] plot_ild(cast, n, h_b, t_b, h_ref, t_ref)

title: Plot the results of two different Monty Hall strategies — plot_montyhall
text: [ggplot] ggplot bar plot showing differences success two strategies.

title: Plot the results of two different Monty Hall strategies — plot_montyhall
code: # Note: your results will look very different if you simulated the two # strategies correctly! plot_montyhall(1000, 500, 500)

what: RREAS survey and Commun Murre diet data — rreas_comu
title: RREAS survey and Commun Murre diet data — rreas_comu
text: Two independent proxies forage fish abundance California Current. (1) Log-transformed estimates catch per unit effort young---year rockfish anchovy Rockfish Recruitment Ecosystem Assessment Survey. (2) Percentage Common Murre diet composed two species observed Southeast Farallon Island. Rockfish data spans 1983-2019, anchovy 1990-2019.

title: RREAS survey and Commun Murre diet data — rreas_comu
RREAS survey and Commun Murre diet data — rreas_comu
text: rreas_comu data frame 37 rows 5 columns: year Year data comu_yoyrockfish, comu_anchovy Fraction Common Murre diet composed young---year rockfish anchovy, respectively. rreas_yoyrockfish, rreas_anchovy Log-transformed catch per unit effort young---year rockfish anchovy, respectively.

title: RREAS survey and Commun Murre diet data — rreas_comu
